subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Phil O’Donnell, the captain for Motherwell of the Scottish Premier League, died Saturday after he collapsed during a game as he was about to leave the field for a substitute.O’Donnell, a 35-year-old midfielder, fell to the ground at Fir Park in Motherwell. He was carried off on a stretcher and taken to a hospital. The Motherwell club chairman, Bill Dickie, said that O’Donnell had a seizure, but did not elaborate. He said there would be an autopsy.The teams completed the game, apparently unaware of O’Donnell’s condition. Motherwell won, 5-3.
